Ideally 8 - 11 years of related experience in a customer facing role, minimum 3 years of experience in pre-sales with enterprise software

The ability to travel up to 25%

MongoDBs mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhereon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
MongoDB, as a database software and consistently voted the #1 most wanted database preferred by developers, is continuing to attract the most demanding, innovative companies and development teams in enterprise software. 
To meet this demand, we are looking for passionate technologists to join our growing Industry Solutions Team (IST), a remote/flexible, globally-dispersed team. Our objective is to align MongoDB as an industry solution and ensure we understand enterprise clients and their needs to modernize software legacies, transition to modernized solutions, and guide them through continuous data-driven modernization. 
The responsibilities of this role include communicating the direction of MongoDBs platform to customers and industry partner communities via content creation, industry-focused demos, leading projects that help drive forward accounts (such as sales enablement, account workshops, internal newsletters, etc.), and more. This is a great opportunity for individuals with a technical background interested in the business solution space, to dive deep into a cross-functional team and be part of one of the fastest growing companies. Were looking for someone who is willing to learn fast and is able to understand the technology we work with, communicate it in a language our customers use, and work with our Industry Consultants and Principals on their projects, taking into consideration the different focal verticals. This role leads towards a consultant role and beyond, with a career trajectory we build out with you, based on your interests and strengths. 
Our team is an exciting, diverse group, made up of ambitious, innovative thinkers that range from software thought leaders and entrepreneurs to young professionals. This role is based out of Mexico City to help our team cover North and South American regions, and requires up to 25% of travel. Learn more about #LifeAtMongoDB here!
What you do at MongoDB

You help generate/deliver content, such as white papers, blogs, webinars, thought leadership, speaking events, etc. that communicates the business value of MongoDB as a leading industry solution
You partner with the rest of the Industry Solutions team to help ensure success in accounts ranging from small startups to large enterprises (i.e customizing solutions, client presentations, client-specific content, etc.)
Assist in Consultant/Principal support of sales through enablement, with activities such as technical discovery, demos, trainings, proof of values, presentations, and documentation of technical decision criteria; working across a number of sales opportunities in parallel
You act as a liaison between our team and Marketing, Sales, and Product, playing an active role in MongoDBs Go-To-Market Strategy
You proactively seek opportunities to support and mentor other team members and share best practices
Enjoy the ride because were growing fast!

As an ideal candidate, you will have

At least 3 years of relevant work experience in the tech sector, or relevant technical experience in other sectors
Ability and willingness to learn quickly and adapt to new industries
A balance of technical knowledge as well as communication/presentation skills
A foundational knowledge of data, data science, data analytics, and/or data engineering (you will become more of an expert on the job!)
A diverse experience or interest in multiple industries (we have a broad range of clients and need to understand their industries to adapt solutions)
The ability to manage and work with multiple stakeholders effectively
A pro-active, self-starter with the drive to learn new skills and become an expert in that field
The ability to travel up to 25% in normal circumstances for conferences, clients, team shadowing, team events, MongoDB events, etc. 
A strong sense of team-work working towards a common goal with process-oriented skills

As an ideal candidate, you may also have

A Masters degree or equivalent work experience in the tech sector
Experience with databases and/or deploying applications with any of the major cloud providers or database vendors
Experience with database programming and data models 
A MongoDB Certification 
Proficiency in more than one language

What you will learn

Working in a fast paced tech company and being integrated into a can-do team where responsibility for your own work and intellectual honesty are crucial
The rapidly expanding MongoDB product suite, including

Atlas (fully managed cloud database service)
Atlas Search
Realm Mobile Databases and Solutions
Other tools and connectors

Exposure to a wide variety of market verticals and a broad spectrum of interesting use cases
Cross-industry tech modernization understanding
Understanding of product and program management in a fast moving tech company
Process thinking, planning and project management skills
Sales engagement models, sales qualification in a global company

5+ years of experience in computer programming 

Experience in databases and/or data management systems is a huge plus, but not a requirement

Hands-on experience building industrial-strength software
Solid computer science fundamentals, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design/architecture
Experience with large code bases, preferably in C++
B.Sc. in Computer Science or similar field, or equivalent practical experience
Interest in the theory and practice of database query engines. Hands-on experience or M.Sc./Ph.D in the domain is a plus

Position Expectations

Understand and improve current functionality of the MongoDB query engine
Contribute high quality C++ code and give and solicit feedback in code reviews
Identify, design, implement, test, and support new features related to query performance and robustness, query language enhancements, diagnostics for query performance problems, and integration with other products and tools
Work constructively with peers to deliver excellent technical solutions

In three months youll have contributed to the development of a project slated for the next major version, as well as fixed a few bugs in a minor version of our latest stable release series

We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhereon premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, its no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
Individuals in the Associate Customer Success Manager role have a passion for technology and the ambition to dive head-first into new challenges. This is a product-led team rooted in innovation , so we are looking for someone who can thrive with a high level of ambiguity and operate with a high amount of autonomy while maintaining a customer centric approach and helping to evolve the program to engage with customers at the right time, with the right information, in the right way.
In this role you will work as the primary point of contact for MongoDB end users across a large portfolio of growing MongoDB Atlas customers. You will be responsible for acting as the account team leader bringing together Sales, Professional Services, Technical Services, etc. to drive positive outcomes for our customers. 
We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in So Paulo for our hybrid working model.
Our ideal candidate will have

2+ years experience working in a Customer Success, Account Management, Client Services or other similarly customer-centric role
A background and passion for driving growth within a customer portfolio through enablement sessions, strategy meetings, business reviews, etc
A mind for technology - well teach you about MongoDB and databases, but our customers and product are inherently technical and you should have an aptitude and curiosity to learn about those concepts
The ability to act with a high level of autonomy, you will be expected to take ownership of our customer portfolio and make key decisions to drive effective customer outcomes; including deciding how to de-risk or de-escalate customer issues and conflict, and how to drive effective customer outcomes through both 1 to 1 and 1 to Many activities for the wider portfolio
An entrepreneurial mindset - this is a new team at MongoDB where you will be required to both deviate from established procedure and use data-driven analysis to build new process or practices that enhance our service of this customer segment
Team player and passion for collaboration - this role will work with some of our most strategic growth customers so must align closely to Sales, Professional Services, Tech Services, and the broader MDB ecosystem
Prior exposure to database, cloud, and infrastructure technology is a plus
Experience in developing 1:Many customer programs, or customer marketing is a plus
Bilingual in Portuguese & English required

On a given day in this role you will

Work as a strategic advisor to your customer providing them with guidance on MongoDB best practices and their overall technology strategy; this could include running enablement sessions alone or with another internal MongoDB team members, advising the customer on strategies to optimize their technical environment or current spend with MongoDB, positioning and recommending product features and best practices to accelerate customers time to value and growth
Collect feedback and identify roadblocks from customers to inform internal teams including Product, Professional Services, and Leadership on how MongoDB can build a stronger product and go to market organization
Act as the link between our customers and product engineering to develop new innovative solutions. You will be key in building the future roadmap of our product by acting as the Product teams eyes and ears in this field
De-escalate and resolve critical customer issues and complaints by finding the best possible solution for both the customer and MongoDB; this could include anything from navigating a customer outage that has a financial impact on their business, to helping an application team devise a custom MongoDB solution or implementation for their critical application, no day is the same
Build and execute portfolio plans to drive mitigate risk and growth through select 1 to 1 and larger 1 to many activities for the Scaled Americas portfolio
Lead business reviews for strategic customers in your portfolio, including interfacing with C-suite executives and other technical leaders to align to business objectives and agree to a mutual success plan
Work on strategic internal projects to help build the Customer Success program; our expectation is that anyone in this role has strong business acumen and the ability to create and teach best practices, new process, and enablement to the broader organization
Document all customer interactions in internal systems, including Gainsight and Salesforce.com
Provide feedback and guidance to leadership on key signals within MongoDB Atlas that indicate healthy or unhealthy customer accounts; as our product evolves, well need to be constantly adjusting our engagement strategies based on these signals, which youll be in the best position to identify and share back with internal teams

Title: EMEA PMO Manager
RoleDescription:
About The Company
MongoDB's mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. Atlas allows customers to build anywhereon the edge, on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 developers joining MongoDB every month, it's no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
About The Team
The MongoDB Technical Services Portfolio Management Office (PMO) enables strategic execution and organizational transformation across our global Technical Services (TS) organization. Supporting millions of developers and 50,000+ customers worldwide, our PMO facilitates portfolio governance, capability development, and cross-functional collaboration that drives measurable customer impact and business value.
As trusted partners and strategic enablers to Technical Services leadership, our PMO implements mechanisms and frameworks that accelerate decision-making, optimize our investments, and ensure alignment between global strategy and regional execution. Through systematic portfolio management and cross-functional partnerships, we empower our teams to deliver exceptional results while building sustainable, high-performing capabilities that scale with MongoDB's rapid growth.
Our PMO operates as a bridge-building organization, connecting regional expertise with global strategy, facilitating knowledge sharing across cultures and time zones, and championing customer-centric approaches that translate internal excellence into external value. This collaborative approach positions Technical Services and MongoDB to capture emerging market opportunities, maximize stakeholder value, and set new industry benchmarks.
About The Role
As EMEA PMO Manager, Technical Services you'll establish and scale PMO capabilities that drive regional success while contributing to global PMO strategy development. You'll build a high-performing distributed team of Program Managers and create excellence standards that ensure global alignment and regional effectiveness.
In this strategic leadership role, you'll guide EMEA PMO operations through portfolio governance, talent development, and organizational transformation. Partnering with global PMO and Technical Services leadership teams, you'll champion regional expertise and cultural adaptation while translating global strategic priorities into successful regional outcomes across MongoDBs diverse markets.
The ideal candidate will be a:

Strategic Architect: Someone who naturally sees beyond traditional boundaries and identifies transformative possibilities. A leader who instinctively connects operational work to strategic outcomes and has the courage to champion bold, systematic change despite initial skepticism or resistance.
Customer Champion: Someone who obsesses over customers in every decision and refuses to accept the status quo if it doesnt translate to customer value. Someone who asks how does this help our customers? and builds teams that share this customer-first mindset.
Results Driver: A data-driven leader who instinctively measures what matters and communicates impact clearly. Someone who balances analytical rigor with pragmatic action, using insights to drive decisions rather than just reporting metrics.
Bridge Builder: A collaborative leader who naturally connects people, ideas, and resources across boundaries. Someone who builds trust quickly, facilitates difficult conversations, and creates lasting partnerships that outlive individual initiatives.
Complexity Navigator: A systems thinker who excels in ambiguous environments with multiple moving parts. Someone who untangles interdependencies across regions, stakeholders, and priorities, creating order from chaos while maintaining strategic momentum.
Talent Builder: A leader who genuinely invests in others success and sees developing people as their highest leverage activity. Someone who creates psychological safety for growth while setting high standards, building careers rather than just managing performance.
Sustainable Leader: A thoughtful leader who balances ambition with wisdom, pushing for excellence while protecting team wellbeing. Someone who builds for the long term and understands that sustainable performance requires both challenge and support.

Should I Apply?
If you're passionate about building world-class PMO capabilities, developing talent, and driving strategic impact across diverse markets, we encourage you to apply  even if you don't meet all the criteria listed. We value diversity and welcome candidates from all backgrounds.
We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Dublin for our hybrid working model. The working model for this role can be in office (3 days a week) or flexible (2 days a week). 
Requirements

Foundation: At least 8+ years in program/portfolio management with 3+ years in people management and/or team leadership roles, ideally in technical or startup environments. Experience managing distributed teams across multiple regions/cultures preferred.
Leadership & People Development: Experience building high-performing, collaborative teams and developing talent at various experience levels. Exceptional ability to attract, develop, and retain high-performing distributed teams through coaching, mentoring, and structured development and performance management programs.  
Strategic Thinking & Execution: Strong business acumen and critical thinking skills with proven track record of building effective strategies and solutions in rapidly evolving environments. Solid big-picture thinker able to lean into ambiguity, establish clear direction, and drive the delivery of complex initiatives that create measurable business value.
Communication & Influence: Outstanding communication skills with ability to influence leadership and senior stakeholders across multiple regions. Experience facilitating cross-cultural collaboration. Fluency in English required; additional European languages preferred. 
Cultural Understanding: Understanding of EMEA business environments, including cultural nuances, regulatory requirements, and market dynamics. Experience working across multiple countries with awareness of local business practices and customer needs.
PMO Maturity: Proven experience implementing PMO frameworks, governance structures, and maturity models. Knowledge of portfolio management best practices, resource optimization techniques, and value realization methodologies. 
Change Leadership: Experience leading organizational transformation and change management initiatives. Ability to drive the successful adoption of new processes, tools, and methodologies across distributed teams. Track record of building consensus and managing resistance to change.

Success Measures

In 3 months: Complete comprehensive EMEA assessment (incl. stakeholder mapping, current state analysis, and capability gaps). Establish strong working relationships with key regional leaders and align with/contribute to building Global PMO practices and standards.
In 6 months: Implement consistent PMO operating rhythms and portfolio management frameworks across EMEA. Demonstrate measurable improvements in stakeholder satisfaction and initiative visibility. Establish team development priorities with initial quick wins delivered.
In 12 months: Lead a high-performing, cohesive EMEA PMO team with clearly defined roles and accountability structures. Achieve operational excellence in portfolio management and delivery, and establish the EMEA PMO as a trusted strategic partner enabling the successful execution of global Technical Services priorities.

What's In It For You

Leadership Impact: Shape Global TS PMO excellence across one of MongoDB's fastest-growing regions. Build and lead a world-class team that enables Technical Services to deliver exceptional customer experiences at scale.
Career Growth: Establish yourself as a PMO leader in one of the world's most innovative technology companies.  Access executive development programs, join our global leadership community, and benefit from mentorship and knowledge sharing across diverse experience levels and tenures.
Global Exposure: Collaborate with diverse, international teams while becoming a regional expert in one of the world's most dynamic markets. Influence global Technical Services and PMO strategy while pioneering regional innovations.
Work-Life Harmony, Flexibility & Autonomy: We value work-life balance and offer multiple working models including flexible work-from-home options and collaborative office opportunities. You'll have the autonomy to #OwnWhatYouDo and #MakeItMatter with the support needed to achieve independence.
Competitive Compensation & Benefits: Join a company that invests in top talent - we pay in the 95th percentile with comprehensive benefits including equity participation, flexible PTO, generous parental leave, premium health coverage, and many additional regional specific benefits that support your personal and professional success.
